article.headline: San Francisco 71, Pepperdine 63
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. (AP) -- Alan Wiggins scored 18 points and San Francisco ended a four-game losing streak with a 71-63 win at Pepperdine in the West Coast Conference opener for both teams. Armondo Surratt, Jerome Gumbs and Jason Wallace-Carter each added 13 points for the Dons (5-9), with Wallace-Carter coming up especially big in a decisive 17-2 San Francisco run to close the game. Wallace-Carter scored eight of the Dons' first 10 points during the closing rally. Pepperdine (4-9) was held without a field goal for the last final 5:57. Michael Gerrity led the Waves with 19 points but missed a pair of key free throws that could have pulled them within three with 47 seconds left. Instead, Danny Cavic hit a pair of free throws at the other end to put the game out of reach, 70-63, with 37 seconds left. Willie Galick added 11 points for the Waves, who had won nine of their last 10 conference openers before Saturday. Pepperdine led 31-27 at the break and took their biggest lead, 34-27, after Gerrity's three-point play on Pepperdine's first possession of the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
